comment: His lectures are very chaotic and often he doesn't have the time he wants to finish the lectures. He also taught us some of the algorithms incorrectly and we had to correct him a few times on quizzes or assignments. He also is bad at preparing us for our tests and just throws a whole list of topics at us rather than what he actually cares about.

This professor is one of the worst I've taken in my degree. His lectures are not very helpful because he only reads off the PowerPoint slides and is hard to understand. He also only covers each concept once in class and expects you to memorize it. To top it off he is very disrespectful to students in class when asking questions or when presenting.

Worst professor ive had in my degree so far. Deserves to be fired. Thinks hes right even though the whole class points out his mistakes multiple times. The ONLY resources are his awful 30 minute lectures, and NOTHING else. No other ways to study for his awful, horribly worded tests and quizzes. The whole groupme hated him, KSU is a joke now.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Im not going to waste yall time. If u want to actually learn dont take him . If u want to actually pass aslso dont take him. Basically dont take him at all costs bro is the worst prof I have had in my entire life of school and im not even exaggerating. He doesnt answer emails and his the hardest grader I have ever had.GGS to you if u get him.
He is the worst professor ever!! Avoid him at all cost!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Not that bad. 1 midterm 1 final 3 quizzes 3-4 assignments - all are not too difficult. The project was the worst (not completing the project but the actual presentation) - he gives you a strict time limit to present, but during your presentation he will talk over/interrupt just very rude infront of the class. He does the same in other classes.

The only good thing about this professor is he's a lenient grader. He takes attendance for a grade, so his lectures are mandatory, but all he does is read off powerpoint slides. Combative towards students, gives very vague project instructions with no guidelines. Don't take him unless you have no other option.

He's hard to understand, quiet, and uses the whiteboard to work problems, so if you're not in the first row, good luck. Mandatory lectures. Quizzes/tests are only announced in person via a quick comment. He's not big on D2L. Combative towards students. However, easiest grader I've ever had. I got a B but I had to endure a semester of frustration.

Excellent teaching and course content! Good flow! But to score high, we have to attend every class to catch up with the knowledge that he delivers! One of the best professors to date for me at KSU. Have an interest in learning - for future interviews and a good project for your resume. He helps & lenient in grading. Be self-driven! Jump in for ML!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Extremely dull lectures, awful communicator, assigns projects with unclear instructions and little to no guidance. The only heads up for quizzes is a brief half-sentence mention of them the class before in the middle of reading off powerpoints. Lenient grader and at the end of the day an easy class to pass but frustrating.

This professor is not helpful and doesn't know how to use D2L. Standoffish when asking for help. No notifications warning of upcoming assignments or exams. You'll have to read the syllabus daily to keep up with due dates since that seems to be the only method of communicating class changes. There are much better instructors at KSU. Avoid this one.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things
